intro: Chrysiphiala incarnata, commonly known as the pink flame vine, is a striking member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its vibrant pink to red tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The plant is typically grown as a climbing vine, and it thrives in full sun with well-drained soil.
